H0.text: Wavelength is the part of a sound wave that measures loudness.

H1.text: Magnitude is the part of a sound wave that measures loudness.

H2.text: Amplitude is the part of a sound wave that measures loudness.

H3.text: Frequency is the part of a sound wave that measures loudness.

A4.text: Loudness is related to amplitude and intensity and is one of the most salient qualities of a sound, although in general sounds it can be recognized independently of amplitude.

A5.text: The amplitude of sound waves and audio signals (which relates to the volume) conventionally refers to the amplitude of the air pressure in the wave.
